channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: People died where they fell as toxic gas escaped from chemical plant
item.description: Bodies lay crumpled on the ground beside toppled motorcycles and cars as suffocating toxic gas rose from a chemical plant in southern India in the early hours of Thursday morning.

item.title: One of Trump's personal valets has tested positive for coronavirus
item.description: A member of the US Navy who serves as one of President Donald Trump's personal valets has tested positive for coronavirus, CNN has learned Thursday, raising concerns about the President's possible exposure to the virus.

item.title: Poland postpones presidential election
Hear from Covid-19 patient who had virus in December
item.description: Some of the first indications of Covid-19 in Europe seemed to hit in February. But a group of doctors in Paris have re-checked old samples and found that one patient they treated in December for pneumonia, actually had Covid-19. CNN's Melissa Bell speaks with that patient, Amirouche Hammar.

item.title: How Merkel went from lame duck to global leader on coronavirus
Trump administration rejects CDC guidance on reopening the US
Trump's reaction when nurse says she lacks protective equipment
item.description: President Donald Trump disagreed with a nurse he was honoring in the Oval Office, insisting that he hadn't heard about personal protective equipment shortages in the US despite her account that PPE availability is "sporadic."

item.title: The '10 plain truths' about the pandemic, according to a former CDC director
Health director says ramping up testing in US will be 'a wild ride'
The UK economy is heading for its worst crash in 300 years
Ibiza's nightlife is legendary. Covid-19 has crashed that party
item.description: This year, Ibiza's nightclubs were promoting the most famous names in house music - then Covid-19 arrived. CNN's Scott McLean reports on what the pandemic means for the Spanish party island.

item.title: This is how hotels will change after Covid-19
item.description: Goodbye, breakfast buffets and bellhop service. Hello, temperature screening and keyless check-in.

item.title: Melania Trump's 'Be Best' initiative has achieved few of its objectives at 2-year mark
item.description: First lady Melania Trump's "Be Best" initiative will mark its second anniversary Thursday, with few of the objectives announced at the first anniversary accomplished.

item.title: Customers shot 2 McDonald's employees after being told to leave
item.description: Two McDonald's employees in Oklahoma City were shot Wednesday after they told two customers to leave the store's dining area, police said.

item.title: Axl Rose and Steve Mnuchin engage in not-so-civil Twitter war
item.description: Guns N' Roses frontman Axl Rose didn't hold back on his view of Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin, setting off a Twitter spat during the middle of a global pandemic.

item.title: 'I don't want to die,' says UFC boss Dana White as sport gets back to business
item.description: The eyes of the sports world -- and quite possibly beyond -- are on Dana White and his Ultimate Fighting Championship, with three fight nights planned in the space of eight days in May.

item.title: The coronavirus is crushing the world's most prolific film industry
item.description: This is supposed to be a busy time of year for Bollywood. School exams are over and Hollywood's summer blockbusters are typically still a couple of months away, making it the perfect time to release India's big spring flicks.

item.title: Airline won't charge passengers to keep middle seat empty after backlash from lawmakers
item.description: Frontier Airlines abandoned plans to charge customers to keep middle seats open on flights following criticism from lawmakers that the airline was profiting from the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Michael Jordan's children reveal the extent of their dad's competitive streak
item.description: From superior athleticism to his tireless work ethic, there are many contributing factors that make Michael Jordan one of the greatest basketball players of all time.

item.title: Chris Cuomo pokes fun at Andrew Cuomo's newfound celebrity
item.description: CNN's Chris Cuomo pokes fun at his brother's, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D), celebrity and raised profile during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Grimes and Elon Musk's choice of baby name might not be accepted in California
item.description: Elon Musk and Grimes might have told fans their newborn baby boy is called X Ã† A-12 Musk, but it seems the unusual moniker could fall foul of Californian state rules.

item.title: 80-year-old PM says he's no longer 'energetic' and plans to step down
item.description: Lesotho's 80-year-old Prime Minister, Thomas Thabane, says he's no longer "energetic" and will step down in July as the country's leader, his office said Thursday.

item.title: This restaurant in Amsterdam introduced 'quarantine greenhouses' so diners can eat while social distancing
item.description: Missing restaurants while social distancing? You're not alone. One restaurant in the Netherlands, though, has found a solution.

item.title: This is what it's like to travel across Europe right now
item.description: From Athens to Brussels to London, CNN's International Diplomatic Editor Nic Robertson documents once familiar, now unusual, travel across Europe during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: George Pell knew about child sex abuse allegations for decades, Royal Commission documents reveal
item.description: Nearly three years after the release of a damning national report into child sexual abuse, the Australian government has published dozens of previously redacted pages of text relating to Cardinal George Pell.

item.title: Man sentenced to death via Zoom
item.description: A man in Nigeria was sentenced to death via the popular video conferencing app Zoom this week, sparking condemnation from rights groups who described the ruling as inhumane.

item.title: Cruise passengers have gone home, but the crews that looked after them are still stuck at sea
item.description: Most cruise passengers have made their way back home, and the vast ships that once ferried them from port to port are moored up or back on the water, relocating for the next stage in their journeys.

item.title: Woman jailed for opening salon amid lockdown. See what she told judge
item.description: Dallas salon owner Shelly Luther was sentenced to 7 days in jail after refusing to close her salon despite statewide stay-at-home orders.

item.title: Meet Syria's 12-year-old soccer commentator star
item.description: For millions of fans, the suspension of global soccer leagues due to the coronavirus pandemic has deprived them of an outlet for partisan emotion and joy.

item.title: French people urged to eat more cheese as sales slump
item.description: French people are being encouraged to eat more cheese, after the country's coronavirus outbreak caused sales to melt and left farmers with wasted produce.

item.title: Gollum actor Andy Serkis to read entire 'Hobbit' live online for charities
item.description: Actor and director Andy Serkis will read the entire J.R.R. Tolkien novel "The Hobbit" out loud in one marathon sitting on Friday to raise money for charities supporting the UK's National Health Service (NHS).

item.title: Malia Obama makes rare appearance in documentary
item.description: Former first daughter Malia Obama makes a rare appearance on Michelle Obama's Netflix documentary, where she gets emotional after seeing the crowd for her mom's book tour.

item.title: Understanding the rare condition that makes people want to amputate their own limbs
item.description: For some, the universal human desire for wholeness may only be fulfilled by an act of excision.

item.title: Video shows man shoving Texas park ranger into a lake
item.description: A man in Austin, Texas, has been arrested and charged after shoving a park ranger into a lake while the ranger was trying to get a group of people to practice social distancing.

item.title: Banksy donates new artwork honoring health care workers to hospital
item.description: Street artist Banksy unveiled a new artwork honoring health care workers that he donated to the University Hospital Southampton (UHS) in the UK.

item.title: Struggling with migraines? This specific yoga routine can help
item.description: Waking up with a slight headache that becomes painful enough to hinder daily life is the experience of many who suffer from migraines.

item.title: O2 and Virgin Media agree on a $39 billion merger to challenge BT
item.description: O2 and Virgin Media are merging in a landmark deal that could shake up the British telecommunications industry for years to come.

item.title: Rock band to send kids the books an Alaska school district banned
item.description: The band Portugal. The Man is taking a stand after hearing news that an Alaskan school board voted to remove some classic books from elective high school classes.

item.title: Mila Kunis and Ashton Kutcher play 'voice swap'
item.description: Actress Mila Kunis tries hard to hold it together with husband Ashton Kutcher as they mouth out what the other is saying on "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon."

item.title: How Australia could harness its tides for energy
item.description: Australia is famous for its beaches and exhilarating surf. But the ocean offers more than just a surfer's paradise: its tides are also a source of renewable energy.

item.title: The artists manipulating cities into works of 'architectural fiction'
item.description: Architects are -- sometimes to their dismay -- confined by the limits of engineering. In turn, engineers are confined by the limits of physics.

item.title: A manicure amateur attempts nail art at home. The results are not good
item.description: A few weeks into the coronavirus lockdown, it became apparent that our new circumstances would change the way we looked.

item.title: Dad freaks out over 4-year-old son's first home run
item.description: A Georgia dad jumped in the air with excitement after his four-year-old son hit his first home run.

item.title: A photographer's novel solution for shooting portraits during lockdown
item.description: Photographer Guy Furrow wears many hats. He's a popular DJ on the New York City club scene, a rock singer and writes and produces music -- all things that are tough to do right now, due to coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: Trump braces for disastrous jobless tally
SE Cupp: Trump's response to ad was unhinged, even for him
item.description: CNN's SE Cupp talks to Tom Nichols, senior adviser to The Lincoln Project, about President Donald Trump's angry reaction to a new ad from the conservative group criticizing his response to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Japan approves experimental coronavirus drug
Trump says coronavirus task force will continue
Fitness company's success during pandemic
Black people in UK four times more likely to die from Covid-19 than white people
item.description: â€¢ The UK ordered 400,000 gowns from Turkey, then dumped them â€¢ UK economy faces worst crash in 300 years
